interface.name: input_method_context
interface.description: Corresponds to a text model on input method side. An input method context is created on text mode activation on the input method side. It allows to receive information about the text model from the application via events. Input method contexts do not keep state after deactivation and should be destroyed after deactivation is handled.

request.name: commit_string
request.description: Send the commit string text to the applications text model.

request.name: preedit_string
request.description: Send the pre-edit string text to the applications text model.

event.name: surrounding_text
event.description: The plain surrounding text around the input position. Cursor is the position within the surrounding text. Anchor is the position of the selection anchor within the surrounding text. If there is no selected text anchor is the same as cursor.

interface.name: input_method
interface.description: An input method object is responsible to compose text in response to input from hardware or virtual keyboards. There is one input method object per seat. On activate there is a new input method context object created which allows the input method to communicate with the text model.

event.name: activate
event.description: A text model was activated. Creates an input method context object which allows communication with the text model.

event.name: deactivate
event.description: The text model corresponding to the context argument was deactivated. The input method context should be destroyed after deactivation is handled.
